text: or Geishū (芸州) was an old province in the area of Hiroshima Prefecture on the island of Honshū.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). no kuni" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 18. ==History== In the Meiji period, the provinces of Japan were converted into prefectures. The maps of Japan and Aki Province were reformed in the 1870s.Nussbaum, "Provinces and prefectures" at p. 780. ==Shrines and Temples== Itsukushima jinja was the chief Shinto shrine (ichinomiya) of Aki. "Nationwide List of Ichinomiya," p. 3 ; retrieved 2012-1-18. ==Related pages== * Provinces of Japan * Prefectures of Japan * List of regions of Japan * List of islands of Japan ==References== ==Other websites == * Murdoch's map of provinces, 1903 Category:Former provinces of Japan Category:Hiroshima Prefecture
title: Aki Province
